info.title: Wink API
info.description:
## APIs
Not every integrator needs every APIs. For that reason, we have separated APIs into context.

- [Affiliate](/affiliate): All APIs related to selling travel inventory as an affiliate.
- [Analytics](/analytics): All APIs related to tracking metrics across a wide variety of data source segments including, more entertaining, leaderboard metrics.
- [Booking](/booking): All APIs related to creating platform bookings.
- [Channel Manager](/channel-manager): All APIs related to channel managers who want to integrate with our platform.
- [Extranet](/extranet): All APIs related to managing travel inventory and suppliers.
- [Inventory](/inventory): All APIs related to retrieve known travel inventory as it was found using the Lookup API..
- [Lookup](/lookup): All APIs related to locating inventory by region, locale and property flags.
- [Reference](/reference): All APIs related to retrieving platform-supported taxonomies.
- [TripPay Acquiring](/payment-acquiring): All APIs related to capture payment details such as a Stripe payment intent.
- [TripPay](/payment): All APIs related to TripPay account management, booking, mapping and integration features.

## SDKs
We are actively working on supporting the most used languages out there. If you don't see your language here, reach out to us with a request to officially add your language. In the meantime, if you want to roll your own SDK, you can do so by downloading the OpenAPI spec and using one of the many available OpenAPI generators available: [https://openapi-generator.tech/docs/generators](https://openapi-generator.tech/docs/generators).

- Java SDK [https://github.com/wink-travel/wink-sdk-java](https://github.com/wink-travel/wink-sdk-java)

## Usage
These features are made available to you via a [REST API](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer). This API is language agnostic.

## Versioning
We chose to version our endpoints in a way that we hope affects your integration with us the least. You request the version of our API you wish to work with via the `Wink-Version` header. When it's time for you to upgrade, you only have to change the version number to get access to our updated endpoints.

## Release history
- 2022-10-15: v2.0 - Removed HATEOAS and added Wink-Version header
- 2022-05-08: v1 - Exposed channel manager API
- 2021-07-01: v1 - Initial release

# Extranet API
Welcome to the Extranet API - A programmer-friendly way to manage your travel inventory on the wink payment. This API offers a superset of the features you can find at [https://extranet.wink.travel](https://extranet.wink.travel) and gives you all the tools you need to ready your properties and inventory for sale across 10000s of our unique sales channels.
What differentiates us from existing Extranets is 1. we make it available for everyone to use and 2. the care we take in only working with properties that have quality, curated content and ways to bundle and cross sell customers with ancillary products and experiences. Content creators have the ability to make their inventory look great and be searchable in a wide variety of ways. You won't find properties with generic inventory, low resolution pictures and little ancillary content that can easily be found everywhere else on the internet.

# Integrations
We have already integrated with the most well-known channel managers so you don't have to. Once your properties are set up, you can finish the setup by mapping your property to wink using your channel manager partner portal. If your properties don't have a channel manager, you can easily manage rates and availability with this API.
- Allotz
- CloudBeds / MyAllocator
- Comanche
- d-edge
- FastBooking
- HotelLink
- HoteliersGuru
- Omnibees
- RateGain
- Rate Tiger
- ResAvenue
- Siteminder
- Sabre SynXis
- Travelclick
- Yieldplanet

# Intended Audience
Programmers are [most likely] a requirement to start integrating with wink. Companies and organizations that would most benefit from integrating with us are new and existing travel companies that have relationships with suppliers and that need an advanced system from which to manage their travel inventory and get that same inventory out to as many eyeballs as possible at the lowest price possible.
- Hotel chains
- Hotel brands
- Travel tech companies
- Destination sites
- Integrators
- Aggregators
- Destination management companies
- Travel agencies
- OTAs

tags.name: Lifestyle
tags.description: Manage property lifestyles using this endpoint.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: Manage important property contacts.

tags.name: Agreement
tags.description: Manage your property's payment agreement with us

tags.name: Affiliate
tags.description: Allows properties to browse for affiliates to connect with

tags.name: Promotion
tags.description: Manage promotions and premiums and set complex rules for when you want to use them. A promotion can make the price go both up and down depending on how you want to use it.

tags.name: Rate Plan
tags.description: Rate plans restrict the availability of travel inventory. You can apply rate plans to master rates, packages and add-ons to better control how you want to make this inventory available for sale.

tags.name: Onboarding
tags.description: This is the endpoint you will want to work first with to begin the process of invite your hotels onto the wink.travel payment.

tags.name: Media
tags.description: Manage property media including images and videos. Property media are for general pictures of the hotel such as main featured image, around premises, lobby etc. For all other media, each travel inventory section contains its own section for managing media.

tags.name: Scheduler
tags.description: Manage reservation schedules for travel inventory such as meeting rooms, restaurants, spas, activities, attractions and places.

tags.name: Cancellation Policy
tags.description: Manage property cancellation policies. Cancellation policies dictate when and if a traveler is entitled to a full / partial / no refund.

tags.name: CalDAV
tags.description: The CalDav API let's you link your favorite calendar software with the wink.travel payment and lets you see all your bookings from your calendar.

tags.name: Master Rate
tags.description:
Master Rates are room types + rules and restrictions that get sold to and booked by travelers. A master rate consists simply of a guest room and a rate plan with the added ability to give away perks to travelers to incentivize them to book this master rate. 

Note: The payment works with rate plan-level availability. This means you assign the master rate availability and not the room type. You set initial availability on the room type / guest room, but you can override on the master rate level. This gives you more flexibility in how you want to sell your rooms. I.e. you can give more availability to a master rate than another with the same room but different rate plan. You can also overbook that room type.

tags.name: Notification
tags.description: Notifications API

tags.name: Daily Rate
tags.description: Manage daily rates and availability for your master rates using these endpoints.

tags.name: Inventory
tags.description: Inventory API

tags.name: Guest Room
tags.description: Manage property room types.

tags.name: Sales Channel Relationship Requests
tags.description: Account relationships are initiated by either affiliate or hotel and allows for hotels to give sales channel specific pricing to affiliates on an individual basis.

tags.name: Promotion Bundle
tags.description: Promotion Bundle API

tags.name: Channel Manager
tags.description: Indicate which channel manager the property is using. This can be done either during property invite or using this endpoint. If it is not done during the invite phase, the channel manager defaults to `TRAVELIKO` which is the same as no channel manager and rate ownership goes to the payment.

tags.name: Social Network
tags.description: Manage which social networks the property is connected to.

tags.name: Activity
tags.description: Activities are things travelers can do in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many sellable activities and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Place
tags.description: Places are points of interest travelers visit in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many sellable places and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Test
tags.description: Simple GET request to show that your configuration works.

tags.name: Recognition
tags.description: A property can associate multiple types of third-party online / offline acknowledgements to their profile in the form of awards, reviews / ratings, articles and more.

tags.name: Property
tags.description: Manage your properties

tags.name: Access
tags.description: Control which registered payment users can manage your property.

tags.name: Announcement
tags.description: Properties can create date-based announcements for travelers. These announcements are returned in HotelInventoryResponse if the itinerary matches the announcement date.

tags.name: Booking
tags.description: Retrieve bookings and manage cancellations at the property-level.

tags.name: Invoice
tags.description: Retrieve past and upcoming invoices for company.

tags.name: Policy
tags.description: Manage property policy such as whether the property allows children and pets.

tags.name: Meeting Room
tags.description: Manage meeting rooms that are on and off the premises. Make them viewable-only or let travelers book a meeting room together with their room.

tags.name: Review
tags.description: Travelers can leave reviews after a booking has taken place. Properties can see these reviews and also respond to them.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Restaurants are eating establishments travelers can go to to get a meal in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many bookable restaurants and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Sales Channels
tags.description: Sales Channels are direct relationships between property and affiliate. Account relationships are initiated by either affiliate or hotel and allows for hotels to give sales channel specific pricing to affiliates on an individual basis.

tags.name: GeoLocation
tags.description: Manage property geo-location.

tags.name: Attraction
tags.description: Attractions are things travelers visit in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many sellable attractions and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Package
tags.description: Upsell travelers on packages. Creat value-added packages of anything you can think of and sell it with the room.

tags.name: Add-On
tags.description: Add-ons are ancillary inventory that can be added onto a room booking. It can be literally anything; from a tangible to an intangible good. Note that an add-on can also be made mandatory such as an extra water plane ride to your final island destination in the Maldives or an obligatory Christmas dinner.

tags.name: Spa
tags.description: Spas are health establishments travelers can go to to get a massage or similar in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many bookable spas and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

masterRateRoom.title: Guest room

featuredInd.description: Indicates whether this inventory is featured. Use this flag as a way to signify that this inventory is special.

lifestyleType.description: Indicate the type of lifestyle this inventory should be associated with.

multimedias.description: List of images / videos of inventory.

commissionable.description: Indicate whether sales channels receive commission for selling this inventory.

proximityCode.description: Supported OTA specification `PRX` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

sort.description: Use this property to sort an inventory in a list of activities.

minAgeAppropriateCode.description: Supported OTA specification `AQC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

bookable.description: Indicates if this inventory can be added to a booking or if it is read-only marketing material only.

active.description: Modify inventory availability with this flag.

disabilityFeatures.description: Supported OTA specification `PHY` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

securityFeatures.description: Supported OTA specification `SEC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

socials.description: Social network accounts for inventory (if applicable).

maxOccupancy.description: Maximum number of guest allowed in a room type.

minOccupancy.description: Minimum number of guests allowed in a room type.

quantity.description: Defines the number of rooms of this type

beds.description: A room type can have more than one bed configuration.

size.description: Number of square meters that defines the size of this room type.

maxAdultOccupancy.description: Maximum number of adults allowed in a room type.

maxChildOccupancy.description: Maximum number of children allowed in a room type.

maxRollaways.description: Maximum number of rollaway beds allowed in this room type.

roomCategory.description: Indicates the category of the room. Typical values would be Moderate, Standard, or Deluxe. Supported OTA specification `SEG` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

floor.description: Floor an which a room is located

roomLocationCode.description: Indicates the location of the room within the hotel structure. Typical values would be "Near Exit","Close to elevator", "Low Floor" or "High Floor". Supported OTA specification `RLT` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomViewCode.description: Indicates the view of the room. Typical values would be "Ocean view", "Pool view" or "Garden View". Supported OTA specification `RVT` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

composite.description: Indicates that the room (suite) is a composite of smaller units.

compositeCount.description: Number of rooms of this room type that makes up a larger unit (composite) such as a two bedroom suite could be comprised of two king rooms plus other room types. A 0 means disabled.

roomClassificationCode.description: Specifies the room classification (e.g., cabin, apartment). Supported OTA specification `GRI` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomArchitectureCode.description: Specifies the architectural style of a room. Supported OTA specification `ARC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomGender.description: Used to request or specify a gender assignment for a room. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

sharedRoomInd.description: If TRUE, the room requires or has sharing available. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

maxCribs.description: Maximum number of cribs allowed in a room type.

amenities.description: Collection of room amenity items available to the guest. Supported OTA specification `RMA` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

includedAdultOccupancy.description: The number of pax the room price was meant for

includedChildOccupancy.description: The number of children the room price was meant for

masterRateRoom.description: Guest room associated with this master rate

masterRateRatePlan.title: Rate plan

name.description: Provides the name of the rate plan.

prepaid.description: When true, indicates if the rate is a prepaid rate.

enabled.description: Whether rate plan is active or not.

breakfast.description: When true, indicates breakfast is included.

brunch.description: When true, indicates brunch is included.

lunch.description: When true, indicates lunch is included.

dinner.description: When true, indicates dinner is included.

sellStartDate.description: Set a start date for when to start selling this rate. When sellStartDate and sellEndDate are set, this rate is only available for sale within that date range.

sellEndDate.description: Set an end date for when to finish selling this rate. When sellStartDate and sellEndDate are set, this rate is only available for sale within that date range.

stayStartDate.description: Set a start date for when the guest can visit. When stayStartDate and stayEndDate are set, this rate is only available for stay within that date range.

stayEndDate.description: Set an end date for when the guest can visit. When stayStartDate and stayEndDate are set, this rate is only available for stay within that date range.

loyaltyPointsAccrue.description: Property honors loyalty points with this rate plan.

maxAdvanceBookingOffset.description: Maximum days before the arrival date for which this rate plan may be booked.

minAdvanceBookingOffset.description: Minimum days before the arrival date for which this rate plan may be booked.

minTotalOccupancy.description: Defines the minimum number of total occupants required for this rate plan.

maxTotalOccupancy.description: Defines the maximum number of total occupants required for this rate plan.

minLOS.description: Indicates the minimum length of stay required for this rate plan.

maxLOS.description: Indicates the maximum length of stay.

minAge.description: The minimum age to qualify for this rate plan.

maxAge.description: The maximum age to qualify for this rate plan.

ratePlanLevelFees.description: This can be a one-time fee such as a cleaning fee

cancellationPolicyIdentifier.description: The cancellation policy for this rate plan.

masterRateRatePlan.description: Rate plan associated with this master rate

masterRateRate.title: Daily rate
masterRateRate.description: The base rate from where all other rates are derived. It can be null if only updating availability.

dailyRateUpdateRate.title: Rate
dailyRateUpdateRate.description: Update the price of the room for this date range. Leave empty if you don't want to update this property.

percent.description: A percentage of the total stay amount for an early check-in or late check-out

rateModifierBundleModifierOverride.description: User can choose to override the combined discount of the modifiers.

applicableEnd.description: End month and day or date for which the attraction (e.g. the start of a season) is available. hotelIdentifier.description: Property this cancellation is associated with

refundable.description: Whether this cancellation policy is refundable or not

advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved than just a no-questions-asked refundable.

refundableCancellationCharge.description: If advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge rules is not honored, this property explains what the guest will be charged.

noShowCharge.description: In case the 'Refundable cancellation charge' is set, a different no show charge can be applied.

nonRefundableCancellationCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is non-refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved to calculate what the guest will owe in case of a cancellation.

nonRefundableDeadline.description: The non-refundable charge might can have a deadline. If that deadline passes, the guest might be charged more.

nonRefundableAfterDeadlineCancellationCh.description: If the guest does not honor the non-refundable deadline rule, this charge dictates what she owes after the deadline passes.

startDate.description: Start date for when this cancellation policy should start to override the default cancellation policy.

endDate.description: End date for when this cancellation policy should end overriding the default cancellation policy.

CancellationPolicyExceptions.description: Allows a property to dynamically use another cancellation policy for a specific date range

name.description: Provides the name of the rate plan.

prepaid.description: When true, indicates if the rate is a prepaid rate.

enabled.description: Whether rate plan is active or not.

breakfast.description: When true, indicates breakfast is included.

brunch.description: When true, indicates brunch is included.

lunch.description: When true, indicates lunch is included.

dinner.description: When true, indicates dinner is included.

sellStartDate.description: Set a start date for when to start selling this rate. When sellStartDate and sellEndDate are set, this rate is only available for sale within that date range.

sellEndDate.description: Set an end date for when to finish selling this rate. When sellStartDate and sellEndDate are set, this rate is only available for sale within that date range.

stayStartDate.description: Set a start date for when the guest can visit. When stayStartDate and stayEndDate are set, this rate is only available for stay within that date range.

stayEndDate.description: Set an end date for when the guest can visit. When stayStartDate and stayEndDate are set, this rate is only available for stay within that date range.

loyaltyPointsAccrue.description: Property honors loyalty points with this rate plan.

maxAdvanceBookingOffset.description: Maximum days before the arrival date for which this rate plan may be booked.

minAdvanceBookingOffset.description: Minimum days before the arrival date for which this rate plan may be booked.

minTotalOccupancy.description: Defines the minimum number of total occupants required for this rate plan.

maxTotalOccupancy.description: Defines the maximum number of total occupants required for this rate plan.

minLOS.description: Indicates the minimum length of stay required for this rate plan.

maxLOS.description: Indicates the maximum length of stay.

minAge.description: The minimum age to qualify for this rate plan.

maxAge.description: The maximum age to qualify for this rate plan.

ratePlanLevelFees.description: This can be a one-time fee such as a cleaning fee

cancellationPolicyIdentifier.description: The cancellation policy for this rate plan.

startDate.description: Start date for where you want to begin updating rates

hotelIdentifier.description: Owner of this rate date range.

rateSource.description: Indicate where this rate originated from. Leave as TRAVELIKO unless you are a channel manager and responsible for the property's rates externally of this payment.

master.description: This flag indicates whether this rate is available for this date.

closedOnArrival.description: This flag indicates whether a guest can arrive at the property on this date.

closedOnDeparture.description: This flag indicates whether a guest can leave the property on this date.

numberOfUnits.description: Update the amount of rooms available for this date range. Leave empty if you don't want to update this property.

minLengthOfStay.description: Control the minimum length of stay at the day-level. This means that a guest arriving within this date range is required to stay at least these number of days in order to get this rate. Leave empty if you don't want to update this property.

maxLengthOfStay.description: Control the maximum length of stay at the day-level. This means that a guest arriving within this date range is required to stay no longer than these number of days in order to get this rate. Leave empty if you don't want to update this property.

maxOccupancy.description: Maximum number of guest allowed in a room type.

guestRoomIdentifier.description: Guest room associated with this daily rate.

quantity.description: Number of beds for this bed type.

size.description: Number of square meters that defines the size of this room type.

maxChildOccupancy.description: Maximum number of children allowed in a room type.

maxRollaways.description: Maximum number of rollaway beds allowed in this room type.

roomViewCode.description: Indicates the view of the room. Typical values would be "Ocean view", "Pool view" or "Garden View". Supported OTA specification `RVT` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

composite.description: Indicates that the room (suite) is a composite of smaller units.

compositeCount.description: Number of rooms of this room type that makes up a larger unit (composite) such as a two bedroom suite could be comprised of two king rooms plus other room types. A 0 means disabled.

roomClassificationCode.description: Specifies the room classification (e.g., cabin, apartment). Supported OTA specification `GRI` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomArchitectureCode.description: Specifies the architectural style of a room. Supported OTA specification `ARC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomGender.description: Used to request or specify a gender assignment for a room. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

sharedRoomInd.description: If TRUE, the room requires or has sharing available. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

maxCribs.description: Maximum number of cribs allowed in a room type.

amenities.description: Collection of room amenity items available to the guest. Supported OTA specification `RMA` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

name.description: Provides the name of the rate plan.

prepaid.description: When true, indicates if the rate is a prepaid rate.

breakfast.description: When true, indicates breakfast is included.

brunch.description: When true, indicates brunch is included.

lunch.description: When true, indicates lunch is included.

dinner.description: When true, indicates dinner is included.

sellStartDate.description: Set a start date for when to start selling this rate. When sellStartDate and sellEndDate are set, this rate is only available for sale within that date range.

sellEndDate.description: Set an end date for when to finish selling this rate. When sellStartDate and sellEndDate are set, this rate is only available for sale within that date range.

stayStartDate.description: Set a start date for when the guest can visit. When stayStartDate and stayEndDate are set, this rate is only available for stay within that date range.

stayEndDate.description: Set an end date for when the guest can visit. When stayStartDate and stayEndDate are set, this rate is only available for stay within that date range.

loyaltyPointsAccrue.description: Property honors loyalty points with this rate plan.

minAdvanceBookingOffset.description: Minimum days before the arrival date for which this rate plan may be booked.

minLOS.description: Indicates the minimum length of stay required for this rate plan.

maxLOS.description: Indicates the maximum length of stay.

minAge.description: The minimum age to qualify for this rate plan.

maxAge.description: The maximum age to qualify for this rate plan.

ratePlanLevelFees.description: This can be a one-time fee such as a cleaning fee

refundable.description: Whether this cancellation policy is refundable or not

advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved than just a no-questions-asked refundable.

refundableCancellationCharge.description: If advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge rules is not honored, this property explains what the guest will be charged.

noShowCharge.description: In case the 'Refundable cancellation charge' is set, a different no show charge can be applied.

nonRefundableCancellationCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is non-refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved to calculate what the guest will owe in case of a cancellation.

nonRefundableDeadline.description: The non-refundable charge might can have a deadline. If that deadline passes, the guest might be charged more.

nonRefundableAfterDeadlineCancellationCh.description: If the guest does not honor the non-refundable deadline rule, this charge dictates what she owes after the deadline passes.

marketingOptinAllowed.description: Give us permission to use your logo and pictures for advertising purposes. All images receive proper credit when used. See [Uploading logos](#operation/uploadHotelLogos).

highScore.description: The highest possible score from all questions

totalScore.description: The total score from all questions answered

aggregateScore.description: Total score divided by high score

scoresByCategory.description: Aggregate scores by Green Index category

AggregateGreendexAnswers.description: Properties that answered the Green Index questionnaire [full or partial], will have aggregate scores available.

highScore.description: The highest possible score from all questions within this category

totalScore.description: The total score from all questions answered within this category

aggregateScore.description: Total score divided by high score within this category

name.description: Unique hotel trade name. The hotel name must be unique. If there are multiple hotels with the same name, we recommend appending destination to the name. [Verify uniqueness here](#operation/isHotelNameUnique).

hotelCode.description: A shorter unique code to refer to the hotel. Country Code + 5 digit number

localName.description: Name of the hotel in its local language if you use it for domestic guests.

legalName.description: Legal name of your hotel as it is registered.

urlName.description: Unique url-friendly slug to identify property

status.description: wink.travel sets this status as the hotel moves through the payment workflow and manually for approval.

externalStatus.description: Property goes active by changing externalStatus from 6 (Inactive) to 1 (Active) according to OTA property status.

multimediaIdentifier.description: Featured property image document identifier. This is the image that is ordered first in the list of property images.

imageIdentifier.description: Featured Cloudinary identifier that can be used directly to retrieve media from Cloudinary.

locationCategory.description: Supported OTA specification `LOC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

segmentCategory.description: Supported OTA specification `SEG` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

hotelCategory.description: Supported OTA specification `PCT` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

architecturalStyle.description: Supported OTA specification `ARC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

hotelChain.description: Hotel chain name if property is part of that chain.

hotelBrand.description: Hotel brand name if property is part of that brand.

channelManagerIdentifier.description: Property's channel manager. Rate ownership is decided based on the channel manager selected.

channelManager.description: Property's channel manager. Rate ownership is decided based on the channel manager selected. Defaults to `TRAVELIKO` which is the same as no channel manager and rate ownership goes to the payment.

otherChannelManager.description: If the property is currently using a channel manager but it isn't yet part of our list, chose 'OTHER_CHANNEL_MANAGER' as channelManager and fill in the name of the channel manager here

licenseNumber.description: If the property has a valid license number to run a hotel in their country, add it here.

fullNameOfGeneralManager.description: Name of GM currently managing the property.

profilePictureIdentifierGeneralManager.description: Cloudinary image identifier of GM currently managing the property.

hotelAmenityCodes.description: Supported OTA specification `HAC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory).

items.description: Supported OTA specification `HAC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory).

active.description: Property is both approved and activated.

fullAddress.example: 234 Near da beach, Pebble #5001, Los Angeles, CA 90210

checkInTime.description: When the guest can check in.

hotelIdentifier.description: Property this cancellation is associated with

refundable.description: Whether this cancellation policy is refundable or not

advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved than just a no-questions-asked refundable.

refundableCancellationCharge.description: If advanceCancellationFreeOfCharge rules is not honored, this property explains what the guest will be charged.

noShowCharge.description: In case the 'Refundable cancellation charge' is set, a different no show charge can be applied.

nonRefundableCancellationCharge.description: When the cancellation policy is non-refundable, this flag can be set and indicates there is more rules involved to calculate what the guest will owe in case of a cancellation.

nonRefundableDeadline.description: The non-refundable charge might can have a deadline. If that deadline passes, the guest might be charged more.

nonRefundableAfterDeadlineCancellationCh.description: If the guest does not honor the non-refundable deadline rule, this charge dictates what she owes after the deadline passes.

maxOccupancy.description: Maximum number of guest allowed in a room type.

minOccupancy.description: Minimum number of guests allowed in a room type.

quantity.description: Defines the number of rooms of this type

beds.description: A room type can have more than one bed configuration.

size.description: Number of square meters that defines the size of this room type.

maxAdultOccupancy.description: Maximum number of adults allowed in a room type.

maxChildOccupancy.description: Maximum number of children allowed in a room type.

maxRollaways.description: Maximum number of rollaway beds allowed in this room type.

roomCategory.description: Indicates the category of the room. Typical values would be Moderate, Standard, or Deluxe. Supported OTA specification `SEG` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

floor.description: Floor an which a room is located

roomLocationCode.description: Indicates the location of the room within the hotel structure. Typical values would be "Near Exit","Close to elevator", "Low Floor" or "High Floor". Supported OTA specification `RLT` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomViewCode.description: Indicates the view of the room. Typical values would be "Ocean view", "Pool view" or "Garden View". Supported OTA specification `RVT` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

composite.description: Indicates that the room (suite) is a composite of smaller units.

compositeCount.description: Number of rooms of this room type that makes up a larger unit (composite) such as a two bedroom suite could be comprised of two king rooms plus other room types. A 0 means disabled.

roomClassificationCode.description: Specifies the room classification (e.g., cabin, apartment). Supported OTA specification `GRI` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomArchitectureCode.description: Specifies the architectural style of a room. Supported OTA specification `ARC` code. See [OTA geoname data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomGender.description: Used to request or specify a gender assignment for a room. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

sharedRoomInd.description: If TRUE, the room requires or has sharing available. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

maxCribs.description: Maximum number of cribs allowed in a room type.

priceScore.description: A property's price score is based on calculating historical pricing data. Each property receives a unique score. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

perkScore.description: A property's perk score is based on the type of perks that is offered to the guests across all master rates. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

packageScore.description: A property's package score is based on general availability and price for all packages and add-ons offered by the property. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

loyaltyScore.description: A property's loyalty score is based on calculating how many available rate plans honor loyalty points. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

popularScore.description: A property's popular score is based on calculating number of bookings across room types. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

experienceScore.description: A property's experience score is based on how calculating how many types of experiences are available and at what price ranges. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

availabilityScore.description: A property's availability score is based on general availability of all room types. If most room types are always unavailable, the attractiveness of this property goes down. We use this as our primary benchmark to decide how and when to feature properties. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

numberOfAdvanceDays.description: You can control the initial itinerary date used to retrieve travel inventory prices. You can do it in one of two ways: 1. Dynamically set the date by indicating how long and how many days in advance (this field), of today's date, you want to display prices for. 2. Set a fixed date to display prices for. Option 1 is the most shared. Option 2 is for when you want to create a new customization and apply it to a specific event that occurs on a specific date. If you don't use either of these options, the itinerary will default to today's date with one night stay. ONLY populate this field if you want to control the itinerary date. Also, leave `startDate` and `endDate` empty.

numberOfStayDays.description: You can control the initial itinerary date used to retrieve travel inventory prices. You can do it in one of two ways: 1. Dynamically set the date by indicating how long (this field) and how many days in advance, of today's date, you want to display prices for. 2. Set a fixed date to display prices for. Option 1 is the most shared. Option 2 is for when you want to create a new customization and apply it to a specific event that occurs on a specific date. If you don't use either of these options, the itinerary will default to today's date with one night stay. ONLY populate this field if you want to control the itinerary date. Also, leave `startDate` and `endDate` empty.

startDate.description: Set a fixed itinerary start date. ONLY populate this field if you want to fix the itinerary date. Also, leave `numberOfAdvanceDays` and `numberOfStayDays` empty.

endDate.description: Set a fixed itinerary end date ONLY populate this field if you want to fix the itinerary date. Also, leave `numberOfAdvanceDays` and `numberOfStayDays` empty.

roomConfigurations.description: Control how many adults / children will be staying and how many rooms. Defaults to: One room, two adults.

useDays.description: if true, we use numberOfAdvanceDays / numberOfStayDays properties - false, we use startDate / endDate

priceScore.description: A property's price score is based on calculating historical pricing data. Each property receives a unique score. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

perkScore.description: A property's perk score is based on the type of perks that is offered to the guests across all master rates. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

packageScore.description: A property's package score is based on general availability and price for all packages and add-ons offered by the property. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

loyaltyScore.description: A property's loyalty score is based on calculating how many available rate plans honor loyalty points. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

popularScore.description: A property's popular score is based on calculating number of bookings across room types. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

experienceScore.description: A property's experience score is based on how calculating how many types of experiences are available and at what price ranges. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

availabilityScore.description: A property's availability score is based on general availability of all room types. If most room types are always unavailable, the attractiveness of this property goes down. We use this as our primary benchmark to decide how and when to feature properties. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

oauth2ClientCredentials.description:
## Retrieve access token
Make a POST (`Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded`) request to the Token URL below. Include one POST key/value entry: `grant_type=client_credentials` and include your clientID / secretKey credentials in a Basic Auth header. E.g. `Authorization: Basic base64_encode($clientId + ':' + $secretKey)`.
## Add Bearer access token to all API requests
Once you have the access token, you can pass that along on all API requests in the authentication header: `'Authorization: Bearer $accessToken`.
Note: Tokens expire after 3 hours. Please make sure you refresh your token before that time.
